metadata.name: Coalesce 1
metadata.description:
Coalesce is a collection of systems based on circle packing, arrangements of non-overlapping circles that cover a plane. The concept began as a response to the prompt “Draw 10,000 of something” and gradually grew into a larger project.

In a simple application of circle packing, circles are added one at a time and the only constraints for a new circle are the previously placed circles occupying the surface. By tuning the upper and lower bounds of the diameter, the number of circles that fit into a given area may be controlled. 

By implementing boundaries, fields, and additional constraints, complex forms may be drawn using only circles. This collection features different styles, each of which uses a unique combination of constraints to achieve the effect. Each work contains one million circles.

Size: 4000 x 4000px

Created: May 2022

License: CC BY-NC 4.0

PNG (Large): https://app.ardrive.io/#/file/69a3b1b0-f588-4f0f-ab12-e8f0c2041d06/view

PNG (Small): https://app.ardrive.io/#/file/edc824e5-4b2a-4685-ae32-4d418c7869c4/view

SVG: https://app.ardrive.io/#/file/d3cd100e-028b-4cad-a5e5-3a0117c1ee4f/view
